website_summaries.verdict: For such a low price, this is a great fixie bike for commuters.
pros: This fixed-gear or single-speed bike comes at a great low price and is a great option for urban cycling
The steel frame is strong and has good welds
If you're new to fixed gear bikes, this is an excellent choice
Available in six sizes and 12 colors
cons: With the cheaper price comes cheaper parts
Many customers reported broken cranks and pedals after moderate use

customer_reviews.title: Love the frame, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I love my bike, been riding it to and from work for the past couple weeks, but already my chain broke. Other then that I'm super happy. The bike is sturdy and pretty quick. I'm used to 5 ish mile commutes, but now I'm riding 17.5 miles each way and cruising around 15 mph. I bought the single speed because of the price and ruggedness of this type of bike. Really disappointed about the chain though. I just had a link fall apart. I guess I should have done a better job inspecting all the parts. Chains should last more then 300 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton L.

customer_reviews.title: No. Just, no.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great in the pictures, but these are manufactured to the absolute lowest standards. If the parts were any cheaper, sales would cease to exist. Box was slightly damaged, I had to bend the front fork inward to center the wheel mounts and the cranks are comically horrible. One of my "pedals" (they're too cheap to type without parenthesis) was double threaded, so, completely useless without re-threading. Every part on it is the absolute bottom of the barrel quality. 2 stars because I should have known better, and you really do get what you pay for. I gambled and lost.
customer_reviews.author: twa

customer_reviews.title: Bike is weirdly sized and iffy quality!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect the bike to be this big. I am 5'2" so I ordered the X-small, 43 cm size. However, I cannot comfortably ride the bike because the seat is too high? The standover height is 27 cm and my legs are 29 cm so it should work out but there is no space when I stand over the bar. Also why are all the bikes the same size despite being built for people of different heights? Also, the bike is heavy for its size and not that well built overall. It was a disappointing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Trusty rusty
customer_reviews.text: The fit of the bike is a bit too big, I am 5’10 and the 53 cm is a bit tall when I dismount. The assembly process was easy and they supplied all the tools needed. It rides well and has been a trusty commuter for college. The only problem I’ve had is with the tires and rusting. The tires are always deflating and I had already tested the inner tubes and they don’t have any punctures and the Presta valve is secured. There is also rusting of various nuts and screws of the bike after an afternoon in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: ... old Critical for four and a half years and loved it. I was (am) heartbroken that it was ...
customer_reviews.text: I rode my old Critical for four and a half years and loved it. I was (am) heartbroken that it was stolen, bought this one as a replacement and it's great. It was easy to put together and rides very smoothly. Really good quality for the price. I ride daily in NYC in all types of weather and these bikes hold up nicely. I still miss my old one but the Harper is just as solid so far. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Holden

customer_reviews.title: Threads stripped out on pedal bracket
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks use, the threads on the pedal bracket stripped out. vendor wouldn't replace. they referred us to amazon. Amazon is shipping us a new bike. Good for Amazon. My son did not like the handle bars being lower than the seat, All other features of the bike were good and my son likes the bike. It is light, easy to ride, but he needs one to get around campus that will hold together. He likes the bike, we hope the new one will work.
customer_reviews.author: Airsoft dude

customer_reviews.title: Grease and Go!
customer_reviews.text: Put this bike together in about 20 mins. Mostly assembled when I got it except for wrenching on a few parts. First ride was 28 miles and it never failed me. Also got comments on the looks. Great commuter bike and/or leisure rider. It did have one minor scratch on the grey paint, but I touched it up and we are good to go. i would recommend putting some white lithium grease on the chain and in the hubs and crank upon assembly. It comes pretty dry out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: CSI Guy

customer_reviews.title: not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Looks really cool but,,, Much heavier than expected This bike straight up fell apart on me on the second ride. I was riding home from work and the pedal just snapped and caused me to crash and hurt my knee. I then had to walk it home because the bike comes with a loose chain and the tool they sent did nothing but strip out when I attempted to tighten it thats when i discovered the darn thing had a broken link!!!! this thing just fell apart so it hads to be defective returning asap
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: So far the bike is pretty solid. It had a lot of stickers on it so that was annoying to remove, but I'm particular with that stuff. The Birch color is more silver than brown, which is kind of lame but its still a good looking bike. Feels solid and is light enough to carry on my shoulder
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I just want to say that my bike just broke ...
customer_reviews.text: I just want to say that my bike just broke down. One of the pedals broke. I want a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Bike for Expensive Price
customer_reviews.text: This isn't my first bike so I know what I'm talking about. Bought this bike because mine got recently stolen. It has been a shit bike (note: my previous one was $250 and was far superior with only a $50 additional cost). The brakes are squeaky even after "breaking them in" as said from customer support on their official website. Also, the seat is constantly getting unscrewed even after multiple times of screwing it very tightly. The overall quality seems very cheap. I would chose a different bike to save you the trouble. The only good thing this shit is for is uncomfortably taking you from point A to point B with squeaky brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Completely fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Within 1 week the chain started making sounds and broke in 2 different spots while riding! The handle bars were loose and bearing was bent. DO NOT BUY! I am so lucky I know how to ride that I didn’t Get hurt or flip over the handle bars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. If you're 6' 2", do not order the XL size. I fit on it, but barely. Large would have been a better choice. Still, it rides well, and looks good. Also, make sure you have a pump outfitted for presta stem valves. These bikes have them.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Trabulsy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent City Commuter at a Pretty Awesome Price
customer_reviews.text: I live in the downtown area of my city and use this bike for commuting back and forth between anything close enough to make me feel stupid if I was to drive there. The frame is a bit heavier than I had expected but for the price, you can't complain. The bike comes darn near pre-assembled and set-up takes only a few minutes. The bikes aesthetics are on point, and I've received a few compliments already from some mustache laden hipsters while we sipped chai lattes and I'm not sure if that's a good thing or not yet.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: chain clicking
customer_reviews.text: I think the front chainring is misshapen causing the chain to click into place once per rotation. I just ride with headphones and forget about the noise, but you can still feel it in your feet. It's been this way since I took it out of the box, but I thought i could fix it myself. Never got around to it.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Shearer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike. setup it up in less than 30 ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. setup it up in less than 30 minutes. rides smoothly and is everything i expected it to be. great bike for the value you pay. only reason i gave it a star down is because they attach the wheel to one of the pedals pre packaged and while trying to hassle my way of getting the wheel out i bent one of the spokes. they shouldnt make it so difficult to remove the wheel from the packaging and risk damaging the spokes in the process. other than that its a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: cedrick

customer_reviews.title: Front fork bended right out of box
customer_reviews.text: The box arrived undamaged. The fork was bended right out of box. The company needs do some work in quality control.
customer_reviews.author: JIUNN-HORNG F.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible item quality.
customer_reviews.text: I had recently bought this bike and had high hopes for it, only to be thoroughly disappointed with it. The back tire was broken, the bike chain was unoiled, and the bolts on the frame were loose. It is clear I was sent a previously returned package, which is obvious from its shoddy condition. I will not be purchasing this again. BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Don't sell or buy this bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike has design defects. The pedal arm is too long and it hits the front wheel when I make turns. It is so dangerous. The bike looks very stylish but it is defective in designs and sizes. I almost flipped over 180 degrees and got injured badly. I am so disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi K

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart while riding
customer_reviews.text: I got what I paId for. I have to bring an Allen wrench with me every time I ride it because different parts (seat, handlebars, etc) become loose while riding it and start sliding around. It feels pretty dangerous when biking in / around traffic. This is my second critical cycles bike - first one was stolen and had seat issues - second one has handlebar issues (see photo). It’s a great looking bike and easy to assemble but values form over function.
customer_reviews.author: robert nimocks

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Cheap bike
customer_reviews.text: I've had the bike for two months, I just use it to ride to and from class each day, about a mile and half per day. Tires frequently need inflating, handle bar has already broken. Spend the extra money to get a quality bike.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Black

customer_reviews.title: great looking bike. too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: hi critcal team - i purchased this bike back in feb Critical Cycles Harper Single-Speed Fixed Gear Urban Commuter Bike... rode it a few blocks here and there but haven't officially rode it until this past weekend... the crank broke within 5 blocks... the crank spins and spins. i've emailed team@criticalcycles.com with no answer.
customer_reviews.author: Joven Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bike, built well, nice colors.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bike. It comes with the chain set on the sprocket gear. It also comes with a gear shroud, but the gear shroud doesn't actually fit.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat this bike for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is a great purchase! Starting with the easy assembly, to the fit by measurement specs, to the choices in colors. I am very happy with my bike, its a well built machine that gets me around and gets me compliments on a daily basis
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Healy

customer_reviews.title: Critical cycles turned out to be surprisingly awesome! Simple
customer_reviews.text: I pondered the idea of a cheaper bike for a little while. Spent some time on lower end bikes in the $1000 range and always needed upgrades. Critical cycles turned out to be surprisingly awesome! Simple, looks good. A sturdy fast ride. Highly recommend one!
customer_reviews.author: David Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: average bike, low quality components
customer_reviews.text: Buy this bike if you intend to ride around the block and you don't mind cheep parts, if you're going to ride everyday don't buy this bike, frame is ok but the components are really cheep, brake pas lasted 1 month, headset bearings where incorrectly installed, seat is starting to fray.
customer_reviews.author: David Godycki

customer_reviews.title: Bike is great and rides well
customer_reviews.text: Bike is great and rides well. Would have got 5 stars however the seat is a little uncomfortable. Also, the stickers that are on the front forks to show the correct direction they need to face when assembling pulled paint off about the size of a quarter. I contacted Westridge Outdoors and they are sending me new forks free of charge. Great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Barnette

customer_reviews.title: Clicking noise
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple to put together. After about a week the bike started clicking when pedaling and thought the chain was misaligned. Brought it into the bike shop and they told me it was the cheap petals swapped them out and no more clicking.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Frame was damaged and bent upon delivery—not due to shipping
customer_reviews.text: Fork of the bike frame was damaged and unable to assemble. No damage in the shipment itself, just very poor quality product. Now I have to bring to a bike store to pay to fix, or else return this massive item. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: The front tire came out of true, it was probably bounced around a bit in shipment, and they decided the best way to package the front tire is to put a peddle through the spokes, which caused slight bending of the front rim from it being bounced around.
customer_reviews.author: Austin M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great fixie in cool matte black. Rides well, easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Lora

customer_reviews.title: Overall good but cheap hubs
customer_reviews.text: My single speed hub started glitching after a week, I'm probably going to have to replace it. Other than that it's a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Kent Rollins

customer_reviews.title: Tire problem
customer_reviews.text: When bike arrived we put it together and went for a ride only to find out tire had a manufactured defect. Had to take to tire shop to replace tire.
customer_reviews.author: heather porterfield

customer_reviews.title: Keep riding
customer_reviews.text: Cool look 👌. Will be nice to have kickstand in the package.
customer_reviews.author: adam lokic

customer_reviews.title: This bike was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This bike was easy to put together, however, my left pedal seems to have been threaded wrong. We got it on, but the pedal itself is now crooked and tilted downward. I will most likely have to replace the entire pedal arm.
customer_reviews.author: Diedra Cole

customer_reviews.title: I am  disappointed
customer_reviews.text: A rear tire exploded on the third 5-miles ride. Should I mention that the bike goes back to Amazon? I am very disappointed . Actually both tires became flat. I rode on. A asphalt road
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great, not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Not the sturdiest bike in the world and the pedals were a real pain to put on. But hey, if you want a great commuter bike or beater bike, you can't go wrong. If something ever happens to this bike, I'd buy the same one again.
customer_reviews.author: Nick T

customer_reviews.title: Got it will a flat tire and the wheels are ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it will a flat tire and the wheels are a little distorted, the cycle sways a bit. Would never buy it. Now I dont even know how to return it.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bike - slick matte finish - easy to assemble - rides like a dream - nothing bad to say
customer_reviews.author: Margherita Matera

customer_reviews.title: Good, Stable Bike Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, rides like a dream for it being my first commuter/road bike, and from Amazon. I should note, works pretty good for heavier set persons weighing 250+ pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Juan G

customer_reviews.title: Chain broke after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Low quality, the chain litteraly broke after 2 weeks of mild use, a 20 min ride to work. I don’t recommend...
customer_reviews.author: ahmed elkadim

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Bike came in with a bent fork. Adjusted it to try to make it work. Got to the pedals, the crank arm isn’t threaded correctly and the pedal won’t fit. But elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Defective 2X
customer_reviews.text: Left pedal would not screw on. OK..no prob, replaced with another bike. SAME pedal SAME issue. bad manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyAF

customer_reviews.title: Wheels are very untrue.
customer_reviews.text: This bike is overall pretty good., however the wheels came very untrue causing it to wobble as it brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Kaleb

customer_reviews.title: Crank cracked and fell off mid ride — DANGEROUS!
customer_reviews.text: I was starting to accelerate out of a red light, in the middle of an intersection, when the right crank (metal part connected to the pedal) literally snapped off, and fell onto the street. I am lucky not to have lost control and crashed. How does a steel part snap, let alone after only a year and a half of use? I wouldn't believe it if it didn't happen to me.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Good bike
customer_reviews.text: Use it to bike to and from the bus stop every morning and it works like a charm. Assembly is fairly straightforward and took less than an hour
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun bike. Fast and meant just for the road
customer_reviews.text: Really fun bike. Great for short rides like 5 miles or less through town. Very fast bike. I think the cranks on the bigger framesf bike could be longer. Good bike for money and the extra warranty.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Great bike easy to build super fast I haven't had any problems with it I've had it for about 4 months now and it's still great
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Very very low quality and expensive to repair and replace major parts!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the as a gist and have had to spend (reimburse the recipient) $300 for repairs. Most notably the bearing n the front fork and ultimately replace the front fork. It's very very low quality!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Iacobucci

customer_reviews.title: ... from A to B as expected and it looks great. However
customer_reviews.text: It gets me from A to B as expected and it looks great. However, you get what you pay for so some of the parts are cheap -- throw some new brake pads and tires on this and you've got yourself a great bike. A couple reviews complained about the handle bars moving but after REALLY tightening the bolt for the handle bars, that's no longer an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: William Strahan

customer_reviews.title: Good simple bike
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bike that was pretty easy to assemble. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Cauthen

customer_reviews.title: No pedals!
customer_reviews.text: There were no pedals in the shipment... but other than that it seems like a mice bike.
customer_reviews.author: Michael O'meara

customer_reviews.title: great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: very easy to set up, great bike for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the cost. Looks great!. Very easy to assemble just took me 20 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a short 3 mile commute and this is perfect. Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a single speed bike with a little style. I have a short 3 mile commute and this is perfect. Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: the perfect college bike. I've been riding it everyday. Its fast and slick.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike! It’s faster and sturdy. Did I mention it’s super light also?
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Needed to upgrade a cheap component after 2 weeks of use, nearly got hit by a car due to malfunction
customer_reviews.text: A component on the back was broken which made for the pedals to not be able to catch the gears as needed to cycle consistently. It inconsistently caught for a bit so, after this happening on a busy street which almost led to a major accident, I went to my local bike shop and bought a $20 piece that was needed. It was a cheap bike, so don't mind spending the $20 to upgrade a cheap component, but am not considering switching it to a fixie and removing the brakes as I planned, just in case there are other issues and breaks are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike. Very easy to assemble. It looks great. I got the green color.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Guerra

customer_reviews.title: Looks: 5 stars Compliments I receive: 5 stars ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks: 5 stars Compliments I receive: 5 stars Actual functions and things that matter about the bike: 3 stars I have to retighten the bolts on the wheels and the handle bars CONSTANTLY. I've had stronger, more virile people than I tighten them and they still come lose. 3 stars because for the price it's worth the trouble. I ride this bike 30 miles every week on city streets and it holds up well (mostly).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Such a rad little bike for so little money, what can you say badly about a $200 bike? Yeah the seat could be more comfy but its so affordable you can't complain. Love this thing, great little bar/downtown bike!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Hermann

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Easy to install and rides like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ! Easy to install and rides like a dream !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bike so worth it !
customer_reviews.text: Well when I received it the box had a hole from the axel breaking through the box no biggy when your putting it together your gonna need grease for the seat post and the headtube the tires are pretty good brakes are amazing very fast they advertised the tires as 32 mm there actually 23 mm but I ordered bigger ones and they refunded me for them but over all really fast and smooth ride
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for me at 5'2" 130 lb guy
customer_reviews.text: Very light bike, probably 15 lbs. Non damage to box/frame. Picks up speed real fast. Perfect size for me at 5'2" 130 lb guy. Recommend it
customer_reviews.author: kv

customer_reviews.title: Terrible craftsmanship, terrible customer service...
customer_reviews.text: Bent fork tips. Fork defective and too narrow to even fit the front wheel. Terrible customer service also. Returning and never buying something from critical cycles or retrospec (same company) again. Do yourself a favor and buy a used quality bike for a similar price off of craigslist.
customer_reviews.author: Gui Alves

customer_reviews.title: Overall great bike
customer_reviews.text: Great bike all around. The only reasons I'm not giving it five stars are because I needed to buy a different stem to elevate the handlebars enough to make riding comfortable, and because switching between the single speed and fixed hub is unnecessarily complicated thanks to the little washer locks.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: its a good bike, just as good as any 400 dollar ...
customer_reviews.text: its a good bike, just as good as any 400 dollar bike. Works great for commuting to and from work. It's light so carrying up to the 3rd floor aint so bad. Finally a good bike that didnt cost me a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Been enjoying my bike for the past month now! ...
customer_reviews.text: Been enjoying my bike for the past month now! Was nervous to switch to a single speed, but with how light the bike is it is so much easier to manage in the city than what my old bikes were.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, love this bike! The reason for me giving it four stars is due to the fact that the bike is a little heavier than expected for a single speed, as well as the tires being extremely thin. However for the price of the bike, I have no true complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steer Away
customer_reviews.text: Horrible bike. After 4 days of use the bike freewheel hub broke!
customer_reviews.author: Rosa A.

customer_reviews.title: its better to just save more money and buy something of ...
customer_reviews.text: its better to just save more money and buy something of good quality. this is built so bad, cheap components all around and a terribly built frame. DO NOT BUY THIS PLEASE. save yourself
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bike is beautiful. The design quality is better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This bike is beautiful. The design quality is better than I expected, sleek and minimalistic. I am a beginner, so it has taken a few weeks to really get into riding this bike as it has no gears. The seat it comes with is comfortable enough for now.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kim

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but I am cheap so this was expensive for one gear...Just saying.
customer_reviews.author: Jon W

customer_reviews.title: Definite Error in the design as mine was unable to ...
customer_reviews.text: Definite Error in the design as mine was unable to be put together due to a part deformation, had to send back and very cumbersome to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Arianna Murdocca

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Tire popped on first ride when I went over a small bump. Also hard to pedal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need advice
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why the top tube is inclining towards the stem instead of being horizontal like it's supposed to. As a result, I cannot stand over the bike without it being extremely uncomfortable. Did I get the wrong type of wheel? Maybe I should get a 650 front wheel instead or just return?
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: In general the bike is not terrible. But for my son - who is 5'8" ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. In general the bike is not terrible. But for my son - who is 5'8" the rake is way too short. In addition, the tires are too narrow for city riding. There really isn't a viable way to return it... donating to a homeless shelter. Be sure that it fits you or you are stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: GoFigure

product_meta.title: Retrospec Critical Cycles Harper Single-Speed Fixed Gear Urban Commuter Bike
product_meta.description: The harper is the single-speed bicycle you've been looking for-beautiful, lightweight, and affordable. It comes fully decked out with top shelf componentry including a flip-flop hub equipped with both, a fixed and a freewheel cog. Choose the fixed cog for a more aggressive riding style or the freewheel cog for effortless commuting. Single-speed/fixed-gear bikes are valued for their simplicity. With fewer moving parts they offer greater reliability and require less maintenance than bikes with multiple gears. Fewer parts also mean a lighter weight bike. The team at Critical Cycles takes quality very seriously. We sweat the details when designing our bikes, which is why we select brand name components to give you the best ride possible. Sleek, light, and agile, the harper will reward you with many miles of smooth reliable riding.
feature_bullets: Includes a flip-flop hub so you can ride fixed or with a freewheel
Premium hand-built, tig-welded, high-tensile strength steel frame absorbs the bumps in the road and is as durable as can be
Comes standard with 30mm deep-v rims, Kenda Kwest 700 x 28C tires, KMC chain, VP freestyle pedals, and two sets of brakes
All of the components required for a super smooth ride. All of our bikes have a weight limit of 220 lbs.
Includes all the tools you need for building and maintaining your own bicycle

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
